sen.j: 万里小路 惟房（までのこうじ これふさ、永正10年（1513年） - 元亀4年6月9日 (旧暦)（1573年7月7日））は室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Korefusa MADENOKOJI (1513-July 7, 1573) was a court noble in the Muromachi period.
Korefusa MADENOKOJI (1513-July 7, 1573) was a court noble in the Muromachi period.
Korefusa MADENOKOJI (1513 - July 17, 1573) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 1513-July 7, 1573 を1513 - July 17, 1573 に修正しました。 court noble をKugyo (high court noble) に修正しました。

sen.e: He was a child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI.
He was a child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI.
He was a child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI.

sen.j: 子は万里小路輔房、娘（伏見宮貞康親王御息所）、娘（今出川晴季室）など。
sen.e: Sukefusa MADENOKOJI, Imperial Prince Fushimi no miya Sadayasu Miyasundokoro (daughter), the wife of Imadegawa Harusue (daughter) were his children.
sen.cmt: 御息所→定訳不明のためスペルアウトしています。娘（伏見宮貞康親王御息所）、娘（今出川晴季室）→伏見宮貞康親王御息所（娘）、今出川晴季室（娘）→文脈に合わせるため訳出順を逆にしています。
sen.e: Sukefusa MADENOKOJI was his son, and his daughters were Imperial Prince Fushimi no miya Sadayasu's Miyasundokoro and the wife of Imadegawa Harusue.
sen.cmt: I think some of the transliterated terms need to be translated, but the sentence structure is better now
sen.e: Sukefusa MADENOKOJI was his son, and his daughters were Imperial Prince Fushimi no miya Sadayasu's Miyasudokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber) and the wife of Harusue IMAGAWA.
sen.cmt: Miyasundokoro をMiyasudokoro (Lady of the Bedchamber) に修正しました。Imadegawa Harusue をHarusue IMAGAWA に修正しました。

sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Ietoshi HATAKEYAMA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Ietoshi HATAKEYAMA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Ietoshi HATAKEYAMA.
His go (pen name) was Suonin.
His go (pen name) was Suonin.
His go (pen name) was Suonin.
Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
He was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
He was Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

tit.cmt: Brief personal history をBrief Personal History に修正しました。

sen.j: 永正10年（1413年）に万里小路秀房の子として生まれる（正親町天皇の従兄弟にあたる）。
sen.e: In 1413, he was born as the child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI (he was a cousin of Emperor Ogimachi).
In 1413, he was born as the child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI (a cousin of Emperor Ogimachi).
In 1413, he was born as the child of Hidefusa MADENOKOJI (a cousin of Emperor Ogimachi).

sen.j: 天文 (元号)8年（1539年）12月25日 (旧暦)に参議となる。
sen.e: On December 25, 1539, he became a Sangi (councilor).
On December 25, 1539, he became a Sangi (councilor).
On February 12, 1540, he became a Sangi (Royal Advisor).
sen.cmt: December 25, 1539 をFebruary 12, 1540 に修正しました。councilor をRoyal Advisor に修正しました。

sen.j: 元亀4年（1573年）に内大臣となり、同年に死去。
sen.e: In 1573, he became the minister of the center, and passed away in the same year.
In 1573, he became the minister of the center, and passed away in the same year.
In 1573, he became the Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), and passed away in the same year.
sen.cmt: minister of the center をNaidaijin (Minister of the Center) に修正しました。

sen.e: His achievements in politics
His achievements in politics
His achievements in politics

sen.j: 正親町天皇の勅使として、または公家代表として、織田信長と接渉し難しい時代の朝廷運営を支えた。
sen.e: He supported the operation of the imperial court as an Imperial envoy from Emperor Ogimachi, or as a representative of court nobles in the period when it was hard for them to negotiate with Nobunaga ODA.

He supported the operation of the imperial court as an Imperial envoy from Emperor Ogimachi, and as a representative of court nobles in the period when it was hard for them to negotiate with Nobunaga ODA.

He supported the operation of the imperial court as an Imperial envoy from Emperor Ogimachi, and as a representative of court nobles in the period when it was hard for them to negotiate with Nobunaga ODA.
